t: For the choir director: according to Sheminith. A psalm of David.
Help,*pn Lord,*s for no faithful one remains; the*ln loyal have disappeared from the human race.
They*ln lie to one another; they*ln speak with flattering lips and deceptive hearts.
May*ln the Lord*s cut off all flattering lips and*ln the tongue that speaks boastfully.
They*ln say, “Through our tongues we have power; our*ln lips are our own - who can be our master?”
“Because*pn of the devastation of the needy and*ln the groaning of the poor, I*ln will now rise up,” says the Lord.*s “I*ln will provide safety for the one who longs for it.”
The*pn words of the Lord*s are pure words, like*ln silver refined in an earthen furnace, purified*ln seven times.
You,*pn Lord,*s will guard us; you*ln will protect us from this generation forever.
The*ln wicked prowl all around, and*ln what is worthless is exalted by the human race.
